title: Regulation (EU) 2020/ 687 of 17 December 20191 in so far as that Regulation
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Avian Influenza (Temporary
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Avian Influenza (Temporary 
Measures) (No.7) (Second Amendment) Regulations 2021 and come into 
operation at 3pm on 2 January 2022.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited avian influenza (temporary measures) (no.7) (second amendment) regulation 2021 come operation 3pm 2 january 2022

title: Regulation (EU) 2020/ 687 of 17 December 20191 in so far as that Regulation
heading: the Avian Influenza (Temporary Measures) (No.2) Regulations 2021
text_raw:
2. 

the Avian Influenza (Temporary Measures) (No.2) Regulations 2021 

are amended – 

(a) 

in Regulation 2, by the deletion of ‘”protection zone 3”, 

(b) 

in Regulation 3 by the deletion of “partly within protection zone 
3,” and “protection zone 3,” , 

(c) 

in Part 2 of Schedule 1 by the deletion- 

of “(apart from the townlands situate in protection zone 
3)” in both places where it occurs, and 

immediately after “Figullar (apart from the townlands 
situate in” of “protection zone 3 or”, 

(i) 

(ii) 

and 

(d) by the deletion of Part 3 of Schedule 2. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for 
Agriculture, Food and the Marine, 

31 December, 2021. 

JUNE FANNING, 

An officer authorised to authenticate the Seal of the 
Minister. 

1 O.J, L 174 of 3.6.2020, 64; http://data.europa.eu/eli/reg_del/2020/687/oj 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 7th January, 2022.

title: Regulation (EU) 2020/ 687 of 17 December 20191 in so far as that Regulation
heading: (This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

These Regulations provide for the removal of certain temporary measures 
formerly in place to combat the threat posed by avian influenza; most 
restrictions remain in place for the present. 

 
 
 
 
 
 4 [769]
